meanings.definition: Lacking the ability to perceive or understand subtle things.
meanings.sent1: Her imperceptiveness to sarcasm often led to misunderstandings.
meanings.sent2: The imperceptiveness of the security guard allowed the thief to sneak past unnoticed.
meanings.sent3: His imperceptiveness to hints about the surprise party made it hard to keep it a secret.
meanings.sent4: The imperceptiveness of the spy made him the perfect undercover agent.
meanings.sent5: The imperceptiveness of the chameleon's camouflage amazed the researchers.

meanings.definition: The quality of being unaware or oblivious to one's surroundings.
meanings.sent1: His imperceptiveness in crowded places often led to getting lost.
meanings.sent2: The child's imperceptiveness to danger worried his parents.
meanings.sent3: The comedian joked about his imperceptiveness to social cues.
meanings.sent4: Her imperceptiveness in the dark forest made her feel uneasy.
meanings.sent5: The imperceptiveness of the detective almost cost him the case.
